description: From Middle English babe, a variant of earlier baban, perhaps from Old English *baba (“boy, child”), from Proto-Germanic *babô, reduplicated variant of *ba-, *bō- (“father, brother, close male relation”).

entries.meaning: (literary or poetic) A baby or infant; a very young human or animal. [from 14th c.]
examples: These events came to pass when he was but a babe.

entries.meaning: (slang) An attractive person, especially a young woman. [from 20th c.]

examples: Hey, babe, how's about you and me getting together?
